content: blank slate cap by barbara hurd this simple watch cap has details that make it unique a 4-inch long stockinette rectangle is nestled in the folded ribbed brim… perfect for expressing yourself this block is left blank so you can sew on a favorite patch stitch on your favorite college team sport saying monogram etc or decorate with crewel cross-stitch or embroidery etc the yarn used and the stitch gauge make it very soft intentionally so you can pull the peak to lengthen the look or not yarn lion brand wool ease 197 yds/3oz skein i used approximately 150 yds needle size us 7 circulars for body double pointed needles for the crown/peak gauge 16 sts/4 inches in stockinette 28 row/4 in though not important size one size fits most adults 20 inch circumference fit my 22 inch head perfectly to make smaller decrease ribbing in multiples of 2 size 18 inch c/o 72 size 22 inch c/o 88 sts cast on 80 sts pm place marker #1 join and *k1 p1 for 32 stitches pm knit 15 sts in stockinette all knit pm *p1 k1 to 1 st before marker p1 continue in *k1 p1 ribbing and stockinette between the 2nd and 3rd markers for 2 5 inches if you have a patch that needs more height extend the stockinette to desired height on next round *k1 p1 to marker remove marker p to 3rd marker remove marker and finish round *k1 p1 all the way around until 9 inches from the start p2tog around this is the inside remember the brim will flip p 6 rounds don t get frustrated as there is very little purling total p2tog around p 4 rounds p2tog around cut yarn leaving a tail thread tail through all sts twice weave in ends weave in any loose ends on hat flip right-side-out fold on fold line designated by that sweet purl line wear to block now go wild on that stockinette canvas stretch it as you d wear it i stuck a magazine in it then stitch sew attach etc your desired decoration congrats you did it copyright 2025 barbara hurd
